name: GitLook
description: Gemini and GitHub API based platform that provides a detailed report and 20 quiz on your GitHub profile
long_description: GitLook is a specialized diagnostic tool engineered for the GitHub ecosystem. By leveraging Google's Gemini AI and the GitHub API, it performs a deep-tissue analysis of your developer profile. The laboratory generates a comprehensive report on your contribution patterns, linguistic styles in commits, and technical competency areas. Beyond static analysis, it generates an interactive 20-question technical quiz specifically tailored to your public repositories, providing a unique way to benchmark your skills against your own codebase.

name: SafeMe
description: One-command backend Linux server security: firewall, SSH hardening, DDoS protection, integrity checks and more.
long_description: SafeMe is a hardening utility designed to transform standard Linux environments into high-security laboratory nodes with a single command. It evaluates system vulnerabilities and automatically implements defensive protocols including UFW firewall configuration, SSH hardening (disabling root login, custom ports), and anti-DDoS kernel tuning. Additionally, it establishes a persistent monitoring layer that performs file integrity checks and logs unauthorized access attempts, ensuring your production server remains an impenetrable fortress.

name: ChiX - C Language Editor
description: Python based C Code Editor that uses GCC to run code in windows terminal
long_description: ChiX is a lightweight, high-performance editor specifically engineered for C language research. Built with Python for maximum portability, it provides a seamless bridge to the GCC compiler infrastructure on Windows. The laboratory environment features a focused IDE with syntax highlighting designed to reduce cognitive load, one-click compilation, and direct terminal execution. It is the ideal tool for developers who require a responsive, distraction-free environment for rapid C-based algorithm experimentation and laboratory development.

name: GF Model
description: A simple Python client for the GitHub Models API. This package provides an easy-to-use interface to interact with GitHub's free, OpenAI-compatible inference API, allowing you to integrate large language models into your projects with a GitHub Personal Access Token (PAT) instead of a paid API key.
long_description: GF Model is a precision-engineered Python library that simplifies the integration of GitHub's advanced inference models into laboratory software. It removes the friction of complex API configurations by providing an OpenAI-compatible interface that works directly with GitHub Personal Access Tokens. This allows researchers and developers to experiment with state-of-the-art LLMs in their local environments without the need for additional paid subscriptions, making high-level AI experimentation accessible and efficient within the standard Python ecosystem.
